header: Israel’s Zeal Is Not In Accordance With Knowledge

verse: Brothers, my heart’s desire and petition to God for them is for their salvation.
For I testify concerning them that they have a zeal for God— but not in-accordance-with knowledge.

header: For They Are Ignorant of The Source of True Righteousness

verse: For being-ignorant-of the righteousness of God, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God.
For Christ is the end of the Law for righteousness for everyone believing.

header: The Law Requires Performance; True Righteousness Comes By Faith In Christ

verse: For Moses writes [in Lev 18:5] as to the righteousness of the Law that “The person having done them will live by them”.
But the righteousness of faith speaks as follows: “Do not say in your heart, “Who will go up into heaven?”, that is, to bring Christ down,
or “who will go down into the abyss?”, that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.
But what does it say? “The word is near you, in your mouth and in your heart”, that is, the word of  faith which we are proclaiming,
that if you confess with your mouth Jesus as Lord and you believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you will be saved.
For it is believed with the heart resulting-in righteousness, and it is confessed with the mouth resulting in salvation.

header: The Scripture Says Faith Leads To Salvation For Both Jew And Greek

verse: For the Scripture says [in Isa 28:16] “everyone putting-faith upon Him will not be put-to-shame”.
For there is no distinction between both Jew and Greek— for the same Lord is Lord of all, being rich toward all the ones calling-upon Him.
For “everyone who calls-upon the name of the Lord will be saved” [Joel 2:32].

header: This Is Why God Sent Forth His Messengers With The Report About Christ

verse: How then may they call-upon the One in Whom they did not believe? And how may they believe the One Whom they did not hear? And how may they hear without one proclaiming?
And how may they proclaim if they are not sent-forth?— just as it has been written [in Isa 52:7]: “How beautiful are the feet of the ones announcing-good-news-of good things!”
But they did not all obey the good-news, for Isaiah says [in Isa 53:1], “Lord, who put-faith-in our report?”
So the faith comes from a report-hearing, and the report-hearing through a word about Christ.

header: But It Is Not As Though Israel Did Not Hear

verse: But I say— it is not that they did not hear, is it ? On the contrary: “Their voice went-out into all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world” [Ps 19:4].

header: And It Is Not As Though Israel Did Not Know

verse: But I say— it is not that Israel did not know, is it ? First, Moses says [in Deut 32:21] “I will provoke you to jealousy over what is not a nation. I will provoke you to anger over a nation without-understanding”.
And Isaiah is very-bold and says [in Isa 65:1] “I was found by the ones not seeking Me. I became visible to the ones not asking-for Me”.
But with-regard-to Israel He says [in Isa 65:2], “I held-out My hands the whole day toward a disobeying and contradicting people”.
